author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Lee Rosario of Brunswick Corporation explains how he uses Twinmotion to present automotive, marine, and conceptual designs of the future. 

Find out how Rosario uses Twinmotion for advanced design from start to finish: worldbuilding, concept scene building, and even for iterating on concept design, all the way through to adding props and generating a fully animated presentation.

The goal of the presentation is to inform and inspire attendees to new heights of design presentation with Twinmotion.

Learn more about Twinmotion here: twinmotion.com

#AutomotiveDesign, #MarineDesign, #ConceptualDesign, #BrunswickCorporation, #WorldBuilding, #Twinmotion, #UnrealFestOrlando
title: Imagining the Future with Advanced Design in Twinmotion | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, Squint Opera reveals how modular tools can enable teams to live the mantra "work smarter, not harder" by giving them more time to be creative instead of wasting time reinventing the wheel. 
 
Watch to hear about Squint Opera's learned experience in key areas where they've used Unreal Engine to build custom tooling, from building generation to crowd optimization, even to down task management. By leveraging Unreal toolkits such as Geometry Script, PCG, MetaHumans, and Scriptable Tools, they've broken down the barriers to creating large, visually-driven worlds for AEC. 
 
This session starts off with the story of Squint Opera's journey, and its current methodology based on lessons learned along the way. The second half of the session features real-world examples of custom-built tooling for solving common project issues, and a discussion of how attendees could implement smart tooling and build better pipelines for their own projects.
title: Enhancing Digital Twins: Scriptable Tools and Design Workflows for Crowds | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Orlando 2025, we explore how you can now create fully physics-based islands with Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN). 

In this session, find out how to build dynamic, physics-driven gameplay experiences that will captivate your players. 

Learn how physics enhances player interactions, providing consistent and satisfying responses to every action. And explore the possibilities of using physics to create emergent gameplay that keeps players engaged and coming back for more. 

This session dives into what physics in UEFN means for your characters, exploring the capabilities, and the limitations you should be aware of. 

It also includes demonstrations of how to incorporate physics into your game design, along with best practices for building immersive, physics-based gameplay.

Learn more about UEFN here: unrealengine.com/uses/uefn-unreal-editor-for-fortnite

#Physics, #Gameplay, #UnrealEditorForFortnite, #UEFN, #Fortnite, #Discover, #UnrealFestOrla
title: Physics Gameplay in UEFN | Unreal Fest Orlando 2025
